result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew W Briske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DE will have 60 days to pay or may set up a payment plan.
If no further convictions within one year, DE may be eligible for expunction.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

DE has indicated undecided at this time about seeking PCR.

Defendant Matthew W Briske in court with attorney Robert Allen Thorson.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement has been reached in this matter.  State recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter a plea of NC to Ct 2, Ct 1 will be DRI.  Court will accept and find the DE guilty.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  Court will order a fine of $10/CC.  DE will pay within 60 days.  If no further convictions within the next year, the court will authorize expunction.
